headshotImage.caption: S Dhawan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: S Dhawan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Dhawan b Hooda 42 (42b 3x4 1x6 66m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Massive, massive wicket for Hooda. And it's the main man Williams walking. A wrong shot from the Zimbabwe veteran and it costs him. He had perhaps decided yesterday that he wanted to slog-sweep it over square leg. He went through it despite it being a length ball. Didn't make good contact and it is an easy catch to Dhawan at deep backward square leg, who celebrates it with a trademark thigh-slap.

headshotImage.caption: Innocent Kaia, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Innocent Kaia, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: a sound down the leg side, this time Samson is more confident with the appeal and the finger goes up! Thakur and wickets are never far from each other. He bangs it in short, it's angling down the leg side, Kaia pulls but only manages a faint edge down leg and Samson does well to take it comfortably with both hands

headshotImage.caption: RW Chakabva headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RW Chakabva headshot

dismissalComment.html: edged to second slip! Thakur takes his second wicket in three overs. A lot like how Raza got out in the opening ODI - pressing forward a bit outside off for the length ball, playing inside the line and the ball takes a thick edge. The ball flew to Gill and he took it over his head with both hands

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: hits the stumps! First runs and then a wicket from Shardul Thakur, where have we heard that before? Thakur believed in himself and bowled the same ball again, on length and going for the stumps, and Jongwe too believed in his shot: he backed away and went for another drive. But Jongwe missed and Thakur didn't. The bails go flying!

dismissalComment.html: he edges behind this time and Samson grabs it with one hand while diving to his right! Siraj gets the first breakthrough. Shapes the ball away from length on off stump just enough to square up Kaitano a bit, he edges it behind and Samson was going towards his left initially but the swing and edge makes the ball go to his right and he quickly changes direction to grab it with his glove

dismissalComment.html: edged behind and Madhevere is gone! Some really accurate bowling from India. Prasidh pitches it just around off, forces the batter to play at it, and the ball nips away just a hint to kiss the outside edge, Regulation catch for Samson

dismissalText.long: c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav 16 (31b 0x4 0x6 44m) SR: 51.61

dismissalComment.html: Well-judged catch from Kishan running back to end Raza's stay. Raza would be kicking himself. He knows that there is nobody behind square on the off side outside the ring. Read the ball well in a way. It was the wrong'un on a length. Backed away to exploit the off side with a cut but ended up being off balanced and that resulted in a top edge. Kishan did well to take a couple of steps back from backward point to snaffle it. Raza didn't look at ease against spin today and falls cheaply.

dismissalText.commentary: Victor Nyauchi run out (Rahul/†Samson) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: a catch just out of the fielder's reach, but he runs out the other batter! A wild swing this time from Burl, the leading edge goes very high down the ground, three fielders converge, and it lands almost right in between them with mid-off almost getting his hands to it. He quickly picks the ball up and fires a throw at the keeper's end

dismissalText.commentary: Tanaka Chivanga run out (Kuldeep Yadav/Prasidh Krishna) 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness! Another run-out when all these batters have to do is try and bat as much as possible. Burl is on strike first ball, he punches this short of length ball through the covers, and he should either take two or none. He hares across for the first, Chivanga doesn't want a second, but Burl turns around quickly even though the ball has gone straight to deep cover and Burl and Chivanga are nearly face to face now near the keeper's end. Chivanga tries to make a second out of it, but the throw is good enough and Prasidh takes the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Kaia b Chivanga 33 (21b 4x4 0x6 34m) SR: 157.14

dismissalComment.html: Harare roars, Chivanga roars and Dhawan's out of here! A perfect fast bowler's response. Bangs it short and into Dhawan, taking him by surprise. He looks to pull but it gets big on him and he ends up skying in. Kaia takes a couple of steps to his right from square leg and gobbles it up. India two down pretty early.

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! Jongwe leaps high in celebration. Spears it full and outside off, Kishan reaches at it for the drive away from the body. All he manages is to play it on. Strange little innings from Kishan ends, India three down.

headshotImage.caption: Shubman Gill player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Catching practice for deep third and Jongwe has another! Short and wide outside off, it was there for the cut. Gill hops and looks to slash but gets a top edge straight down Evans' throat. Can Zimbabwe spring a surprise from here?

dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul lbw b Nyauchi 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Is that curtains for Rahul? Holdstock raises the dreaded finger and Rahul is off. He has a long chat with Dhawan before taking it upstairs. Nyauchi spears it full around off, aiming at the off pole. Rahul gets forward and looks to work it away, with his head falling to the off side. He misses and the ball strikes him right in front. Three reds. India lose a wicket as well as a review.

commentTextItems.html: seals it with a six over long-on, this wicketkeeper-batter. Where have we seen this before? Got a full delivery on the stumps and dispatched it high over the long-on region for a clean six

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all from us today. We hope you enjoyed our coverage although it was another one-sided game. This is Vishal Dikshit signing off, along with Sudarshanan and Chandan. Ciao!

At the presentation, Zimbabwe Cricket are dedicating today's game to the cause of children's cancer. They're donating $500 and a Zimbabwe jersey to a six-year-old. He also gets a signed ball from Sanju Samson. First up is Regis Chakabva: We had a really good fight in the field. We've struggled to pick early wickets in the last few games and we did that today. We fell shot of runs on the board. Our execution lacked a little bit in the end, and we're looking to score more runs. The bowlers came out charging and they tried to hit their lengths.

Sanju Samson is the Player of the Match for his three catches and unbeaten 43: How much ever time you spend in the middle feels good. I took three catches but I missed a stumping too; as keepers we're used to listening to things we didn't do well. I really enjoyed keeping and contributing to the win. In this match the fast bowlers picked the length much quicker and I really enjoyed keeping.

KL Rahul: We bat deep and it's good for some of the guys to get time in the middle. We weren't nervous. It didn't work (laughs, on the changed batting order), I wanted to get some runs but it didn't happen. Hopefully in the next game. They have some quality bowlers in the attack and they bowled well to Bangladesh, I watched on the television. the bowlers did come hard, they're tall and big and strong boys. Good challenge for us as batters, but we bat deep so it wasn't a worry. We're here to play good cricket and win. It's a great turnout today, it's a weekend, and wherever we go across the world we get good support from Indian fans, so thanks to them.

2.53pm Handshakes all around on the field and in the Indian dressing room as India take the series 2-0 with one match to go. The big crowd here at the Harare Sports Club will be disappointed after another poor performance from the hosts. They took a few wickets today but their batting has been an issue for a while and another top-order collapse meant they were out for a smaller target today than in the opening ODI. India's quicks shone yet again, even without Deepak Chahar, and KL Rahul decided to open today to get some game time but he lasted just five balls. He'll be eager to get some more balls and runs under his belt, like Chahar did with the ball in the series opener. Dhawan, Gill, Hooda and Samson then finished things off, but Kishan will know his stock has been falling for a while now.
Navneet : "Mystery of Chahar should be solved in post match chat."
Aditya: "Samson finishes it off in style! A magnificent strike into the crowd! India win in Zimbabwe after 6 years, and the party starts in the dressing room!"

dismissalText.long: c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav 16 (31b 0x4 0x6 44m) SR: 51.61

dismissalComment.html: Well-judged catch from Kishan running back to end Raza's stay. Raza would be kicking himself. He knows that there is nobody behind square on the off side outside the ring. Read the ball well in a way. It was the wrong'un on a length. Backed away to exploit the off side with a cut but ended up being off balanced and that resulted in a top edge. Kishan did well to take a couple of steps back from backward point to snaffle it. Raza didn't look at ease against spin today and falls cheaply.

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Dhawan b Hooda 42 (42b 3x4 1x6 66m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Massive, massive wicket for Hooda. And it's the main man Williams walking. A wrong shot from the Zimbabwe veteran and it costs him. He had perhaps decided yesterday that he wanted to slog-sweep it over square leg. He went through it despite it being a length ball. Didn't make good contact and it is an easy catch to Dhawan at deep backward square leg, who celebrates it with a trademark thigh-slap.

dismissalComment.html: hits the stumps! First runs and then a wicket from Shardul Thakur, where have we heard that before? Thakur believed in himself and bowled the same ball again, on length and going for the stumps, and Jongwe too believed in his shot: he backed away and went for another drive. But Jongwe missed and Thakur didn't. The bails go flying!

dismissalText.commentary: Tanaka Chivanga run out (Kuldeep Yadav/Prasidh Krishna) 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness! Another run-out when all these batters have to do is try and bat as much as possible. Burl is on strike first ball, he punches this short of length ball through the covers, and he should either take two or none. He hares across for the first, Chivanga doesn't want a second, but Burl turns around quickly even though the ball has gone straight to deep cover and Burl and Chivanga are nearly face to face now near the keeper's end. Chivanga tries to make a second out of it, but the throw is good enough and Prasidh takes the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Takudzwanashe Kaitano c †Samson b Mohammed Siraj 7 (32b 0x4 0x6 39m) SR: 21.87

dismissalComment.html: he edges behind this time and Samson grabs it with one hand while diving to his right! Siraj gets the first breakthrough. Shapes the ball away from length on off stump just enough to square up Kaitano a bit, he edges it behind and Samson was going towards his left initially but the swing and edge makes the ball go to his right and he quickly changes direction to grab it with his glove

dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia c †Samson b Thakur 16 (27b 2x4 0x6 53m) SR: 59.25

dismissalComment.html: a sound down the leg side, this time Samson is more confident with the appeal and the finger goes up! Thakur and wickets are never far from each other. He bangs it in short, it's angling down the leg side, Kaia pulls but only manages a faint edge down leg and Samson does well to take it comfortably with both hands

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva c Shubman Gill b Thakur 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: edged to second slip! Thakur takes his second wicket in three overs. A lot like how Raza got out in the opening ODI - pressing forward a bit outside off for the length ball, playing inside the line and the ball takes a thick edge. The ball flew to Gill and he took it over his head with both hands

dismissalText.long: c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Ishan Kishan b Kuldeep Yadav 16 (31b 0x4 0x6 44m) SR: 51.61

dismissalComment.html: Well-judged catch from Kishan running back to end Raza's stay. Raza would be kicking himself. He knows that there is nobody behind square on the off side outside the ring. Read the ball well in a way. It was the wrong'un on a length. Backed away to exploit the off side with a cut but ended up being off balanced and that resulted in a top edge. Kishan did well to take a couple of steps back from backward point to snaffle it. Raza didn't look at ease against spin today and falls cheaply.

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Dhawan b Hooda 42 (42b 3x4 1x6 66m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Massive, massive wicket for Hooda. And it's the main man Williams walking. A wrong shot from the Zimbabwe veteran and it costs him. He had perhaps decided yesterday that he wanted to slog-sweep it over square leg. He went through it despite it being a length ball. Didn't make good contact and it is an easy catch to Dhawan at deep backward square leg, who celebrates it with a trademark thigh-slap.

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Thakur 6 (16b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: hits the stumps! First runs and then a wicket from Shardul Thakur, where have we heard that before? Thakur believed in himself and bowled the same ball again, on length and going for the stumps, and Jongwe too believed in his shot: he backed away and went for another drive. But Jongwe missed and Thakur didn't. The bails go flying!

dismissalText.commentary: Victor Nyauchi run out (Rahul/†Samson) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: a catch just out of the fielder's reach, but he runs out the other batter! A wild swing this time from Burl, the leading edge goes very high down the ground, three fielders converge, and it lands almost right in between them with mid-off almost getting his hands to it. He quickly picks the ball up and fires a throw at the keeper's end

dismissalText.commentary: Tanaka Chivanga run out (Kuldeep Yadav/Prasidh Krishna) 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: oh goodness! Another run-out when all these batters have to do is try and bat as much as possible. Burl is on strike first ball, he punches this short of length ball through the covers, and he should either take two or none. He hares across for the first, Chivanga doesn't want a second, but Burl turns around quickly even though the ball has gone straight to deep cover and Burl and Chivanga are nearly face to face now near the keeper's end. Chivanga tries to make a second out of it, but the throw is good enough and Prasidh takes the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Kaia b Chivanga 33 (21b 4x4 0x6 34m) SR: 157.14

dismissalComment.html: Harare roars, Chivanga roars and Dhawan's out of here! A perfect fast bowler's response. Bangs it short and into Dhawan, taking him by surprise. He looks to pull but it gets big on him and he ends up skying in. Kaia takes a couple of steps to his right from square leg and gobbles it up. India two down pretty early.

dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul lbw b Nyauchi 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Is that curtains for Rahul? Holdstock raises the dreaded finger and Rahul is off. He has a long chat with Dhawan before taking it upstairs. Nyauchi spears it full around off, aiming at the off pole. Rahul gets forward and looks to work it away, with his head falling to the off side. He misses and the ball strikes him right in front. Three reds. India lose a wicket as well as a review.

Nyauchi spears it full around off, aiming at the off pole. Rahul gets forward and looks to work it away, with his head falling to the off side. He misses and the ball strikes him right in front. Three reds. India lose a wicket as well as a review.

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Kaia b Chivanga 33 (21b 4x4 0x6 34m) SR: 157.14

dismissalComment.html: Harare roars, Chivanga roars and Dhawan's out of here! A perfect fast bowler's response. Bangs it short and into Dhawan, taking him by surprise. He looks to pull but it gets big on him and he ends up skying in. Kaia takes a couple of steps to his right from square leg and gobbles it up. India two down pretty early.

dismissalText.commentary: Ishan Kishan b Jongwe 6 (13b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 46.15

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! Jongwe leaps high in celebration. Spears it full and outside off, Kishan reaches at it for the drive away from the body. All he manages is to play it on. Strange little innings from Kishan ends, India three down.

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill c Evans b Jongwe 33 (34b 6x4 0x6 62m) SR: 97.05

dismissalComment.html: Catching practice for deep third and Jongwe has another! Short and wide outside off, it was there for the cut. Gill hops and looks to slash but gets a top edge straight down Evans' throat. Can Zimbabwe spring a surprise from here?

dismissalText.commentary: Deepak Hooda b Sikandar Raza 25 (36b 3x4 0x6 54m) SR: 69.44

dismissalComment.html: yorks him out! Sikandar Raza is thrilled and he punches the air in delight. It may not change the outcome of the mach but Raza is delighted that he has successfully nailed a slow yorker on off stump which Hooda didn't have an answer for
